DOC.brief_summary: The objective research project develop , evaluate , disseminate Internet-based ( web ) application SMART Recovery : Overcoming Addictions ( OA ) . OA base four point cognitive-behavioral program SMART Recovery ( www.smartrecovery.org ) . The goal OA program help user learn cognitive behavioral skill abstain drinking , drug use , problem gambling . The investigator evaluate effectiveness OA web application heavy drinker randomize clinical trial ( RCT ) follow-ups 3- 6-months . The study design three condition : 1 ) participation face-to-face SMART Recovery meeting alone ; 2 ) use OA web application stand-alone intervention ; 3 ) combine OA web application participation face-to-face SMART Recovery meeting . Study Hypotheses : 1 . All three group reduce alcohol consumption , drug use ( ) , alcohol/drug-related problem relative baseline level 3- 6-month post-baseline assessment . 2 . The OA group ( Experimental group 1 ) show great reduction drinking , drug use ( ) , alcohol/drug-related problem relative face-to-face ( Control ) group . 3 . The OA + face-to-face group ( Experimental group 2 ) good outcome drink drug use variable compare Control group .
DOC.brief_title: Overcoming Addictions : A Randomized Clinical Trial Web Application Based SMART Recovery
DOC.criteria: 1 . Minimum age 18 . 2 . Positive response quantity/frequency screen question regard heavy drinking previous 90 day . 3 . An Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test ( AUDIT ) score 8+ . 4 . Is new member SMART Recovery ( i.e. , join join within last 4 week ) . 5 . Has computer home Internet access . 6 . Has primary focus abstain drinking . 1 . Court mandate 1st time DWI offender . 2 . Current diagnosis drug dependence consider drug dependent . 3 . Current evidence uncontrolled psychosis bipolar disorder . 4 . Evidence significant cognitive impairment brain dysfunction . 5 . English read level 8th grade . 6 .
